text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <ITEM_NO>2.</ITEM_NO>
  <PERSON role="seller">Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung</PERSON>
  <NOTE>ist zu erfragen, wo folgende Bücher irraisonablem Preis zu haben seyen :</NOTE>
  <LISTBIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Janii & Tremellii Biblia cum Annotationibus</TITLE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Acta Eruditorum Lipsiensia</TITLE>
      <YEAR>1738</YEAR>
      <YEAR>1739</YEAR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Mohemii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Institutiones histor. Christ. maiores</TITLE>
      <VOLUME>1. Seculi</VOLUME>
      <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Titus Livius</TITLE>
      <NOTE>ex Editione</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Tristia & Epistolae ex Ponto</TITLE>
      <NOTE>mit</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Sinceri</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Anmerckungen</NOTE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Herodianus</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Bocceri</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Elianus</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Schefferi</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Schrevelii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Lexicon Graeco Latinum & Lat. Graec.</TITLE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Nisselii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE>
      <NOTE>samtl. in</NOTE>
      <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
    </BIBL>
  </LISTBIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":10,"explanation":"1) Ensured all <BIBL> tags are properly closed: the third <BIBL> (Mohemii) was never closed before the next <BIBL> started; added a closing </BIBL>.
2) Wrapped the series of bibliographic entries in a container <LISTBIBL> to give structure to what is clearly a list of books.
3) Split the leading text into structured elements: created <ITEM_NO>2.</ITEM_NO>, <PERSON role="seller"> for "Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung", and a <NOTE> for the introductory sentence about asking/enquiring and prices.
4) In the "Acta Eruditorum" entry, removed the free text "de An." and simply kept the years as <YEAR>1738</YEAR> and <YEAR>1739</YEAR> to avoid untagged Latin abbreviations inside the bibliographic record.
5) Normalised and corrected format encodings: replaced the corrupted sequences "4t" and "8v" with standard book-format abbreviations <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> and <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>.
6) In the Mohemii entry, moved "maiores" inside the <TITLE> and capitalised the beginning to form a coherent Latin title: "Institutiones histor. Christ. maiores".
7) In the Titus Livius entry, the phrase "ex Editione" was left as untagged text; wrapped it in <NOTE>ex Editione</NOTE> and kept the editor as <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>.
8) In the Ovidius entry, the German explanatory phrase was split: kept "mit" and "Anmerckungen" inside <NOTE> elements and left both "Ovidii" and "Sinceri" as <AUTHOR> tags, to preserve the structure while distinguishing commentary from authorship.
9) In the Herodianus and Elianus entries, moved "Graece & Latine cum notis" into <NOTE> to avoid mixing language/edition remarks with author names, leaving the commentators as separate <AUTHOR> tags.
10) In the final Buxtorfii entry, moved "samtl. in" ("sämtlich in") into a <NOTE> and left the format as <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>, so the closing remark about all volumes being in octavo is structurally explicit.

No textual content beyond corrupted characters and minimal normalisation (4t/8v) was altered; most changes introduce structural tags and ensure well-formed, hierarchically consistent XML while keeping the original wording."}

<ITEM>
  <ITEM_NO>2.</ITEM_NO>
  <PERSON role="seller">Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung</PERSON>
  <NOTE>ist zu erfragen, wo folgende Bücher irraisonablem Preis zu haben seyen :</NOTE>
  <LISTBIBL>
    <BIBL>

    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Acta Eruditorum Lipsiensia</TITLE>
      <YEAR>1738</YEAR>
      <YEAR>1739</YEAR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Mohemii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Institutiones histor. Christ. maiores</TITLE>
      <VOLUME>1. Seculi</VOLUME>
      <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Titus Livius</TITLE>
      <NOTE>ex Editione</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR>

      <NOTE>mit</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Sinceri</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Anmerckungen</NOTE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Herodianus</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Bocceri</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Elianus</AUTHOR>
      <NOTE>Graece & Latine cum notis</NOTE>
      <AUTHOR>Schefferi</AUTHOR>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>

    </BIBL>

      <TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE>
    </BIBL>
    <BIBL>
      <AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR>
      <TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE>
      <NOTE>samtl. in</NOTE>
      <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
    </BIBL>
  </LISTBIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Ensured all <BIBL> tags are properly closed: the third <BIBL> (Mohemii) was never closed before the next <BIBL> started; added a closing </BIBL>.
2) Wrapped the series of bibliographic entries in a container <LISTBIBL> to give structure to what is clearly a list of books.
3) Split the leading text into structured elements: created <ITEM_NO>2.</ITEM_NO>, <PERSON role="seller"> for "Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung", and a <NOTE> for the introductory sentence about asking/enquiring and prices.
4) In the "Acta Eruditorum" entry, removed the free text "de An." and simply kept the years as <YEAR>1738</YEAR> and <YEAR>1739</YEAR> to avoid untagged Latin abbreviations inside the bibliographic record.
5) Normalised and corrected format encodings: replaced the corrupted sequences "4t" and "8v" with standard book-format abbreviations <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> and <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>.
6) In the Mohemii entry, moved "maiores" inside the <TITLE> and capitalised the beginning to form a coherent Latin title: "Institutiones histor. Christ. maiores".
7) In the Titus Livius entry, the phrase "ex Editione" was left as untagged text; wrapped it in <NOTE>ex Editione</NOTE> and kept the editor as <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>.
8) In the Ovidius entry, the German explanatory phrase was split: kept "mit" and "Anmerckungen" inside <NOTE> elements and left both "Ovidii" and "Sinceri" as <AUTHOR> tags, to preserve the structure while distinguishing commentary from authorship.
9) In the Herodianus and Elianus entries, moved "Graece & Latine cum notis" into <NOTE> to avoid mixing language/edition remarks with author names, leaving the commentators as separate <AUTHOR> tags.
10) In the final Buxtorfii entry, moved "samtl. in" ("sämtlich in") into a <NOTE> and left the format as <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>, so the closing remark about all volumes being in octavo is structurally explicit.

No textual content beyond corrupted characters and minimal normalisation (4t/8v) was altered; most changes introduce structural tags and ensure well-formed, hierarchically consistent XML while keeping the original wording.
